Due to Double Track Construction, platform changes are needed to remove the existing siding at Central Islip and replace it with the second through-running track. Starting Monday, April 30th thru Friday, May 4th, customers must board and exit on the North Side platform to accommodate the work. Please allow sufficient time to reach the platform & parking lot. Please plan ahead, platform access will alternate between the North and South Side platforms thru August 24th. Platform access will alternate as follows: April 30 - May 4, Customers board/exit from North side platform. May 7 - July 20, Customers board/exit from South side platform. July 21 - August 24, Customers board/exit from North side platform. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience as we work to complete this project in the shortest timeframe possible.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 & May 19-20, Includes Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 and May 19-20 substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs as a result of the March nor'easters. All buses will depart approximately 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. Regular train service will resume each day with the 7:10 PM train to Southeast and the 9:08 PM train from Southeast. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. For full details, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic Bus May_2018.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For full details, see: http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Upper Harlem Bus May_2018.pdf Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for announcements. Thank you for your patience while we complete these important repairs. For full details of these changes, see http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html

Due to Double Track Construction, platform changes are needed to remove the existing siding at Central Islip and replace it with the second through-running track. Starting Monday, April 30th thru Friday, May 4th, customers must board and exit on the North Side platform to accommodate the work. Please allow sufficient time to reach the platform & parking lot. Please plan ahead, platform access will alternate between the North and South Side platforms thru August 24th. Platform access will alternate as follows: April 30 - May 4, Customers board/exit from North side platform. May 7 - July 20, Customers board/exit from South side platform. July 21 - August 24, Customers board/exit from North side platform. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience as we work to complete this project in the shortest time frame possible.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 & May 19-20, Includes Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 and May 19-20 substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs as a result of the March nor'easters. All buses will depart approximately 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. Regular train service will resume each day with the 7:10 PM train to Southeast and the 9:08 PM train from Southeast. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. For full details, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic_Bus_May_2018.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For full details, see: http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Upper_Harlem_Bus_May_2018.pdf Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for announcements. Thank you for your patience while we complete these important repairs. For full details of these changes, see http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html

Take the LIRR to Belmont Park Spring Meet

The thoroughbreds are off and running and so is LIRR train service to Belmont Park for the Spring Meet now through July 15. Ride the LIRR to Belmont and get $1 off the regular grandstand admission when you show your rail ticket. Purchase LIRR tickets to Belmont Park at staffed LIRR ticket windows, full service ticket machines or through MTA eTix, the LIRR's free mobile ticketing app. Please remember to activate MTA eTix just before boarding your train.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 & May 19-20, Includes Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 and May 19-20 substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs as a result of the March nor'easters. All buses will depart approximately 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. Regular train service will resume each day with the 7:10 PM train to Southeast and the 9:08 PM train from Southeast. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. For full details, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic Bus May_2018.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For full details, see: http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Upper Harlem Bus May_2018.pdf Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for announcements. Thank you for your patience while we complete these important repairs. For full details of these changes, see http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html

Due to Double Track Construction, platform changes are needed to remove the existing siding at Central Islip and replace it with the second through-running track. Please plan ahead, platform access will alternate between the North and South Side platforms thru August 24th. Platform access will alternate as follows: April 30 - May 4, Customers board/exit from North side platform. May 7 - July 20, Customers board/exit from South side platform. July 21 - August 24, Customers board/exit from North side platform. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience as we work to complete this project in the shortest timeframe possible.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 & May 19-20, Includes Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 28-29, May 5-6 and May 19-20 substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs as a result of the March nor'easters. All buses will depart approximately 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. Regular train service will resume each day with the 7:10 PM train to Southeast and the 9:08 PM train from Southeast. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. For full details, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic Bus May_2018.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For full details, see: http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Upper Harlem Bus May_2018.pdf Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for announcements. Thank you for your patience while we complete these important repairs. For full details of these changes, see http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html

There are changes to connecting service on other branches, plus some eastbound Friday night trains will depart Penn Station a few minutes earlier than usual. Substitute buses will operate between Waterbury and Bridgeport for all trains on Saturdays, April 21 & 28 and for select trains on Sundays, April 22 & 29 to accommodate Devon Bridge work. Bridgeport-bound buses will operate up to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. On Sundays, regular train service will resume with the 7:02 PM train departing Grand Central Terminal, the 8:42 PM departing Bridgeport and the 10:10 PM departing Waterbury. For full details, see https://goo.gl/vdhE7B. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement work.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-29, Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-22 & 28-29, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work. Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth - Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mtamnr/

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-29, Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-22 & 28-29, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-29, Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-22 & 28-29, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-29, Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-22 & 28-29, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-29, Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic.

For Saturdays and Sundays, April 21-22 & 28-29, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: - Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf - Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Come join us for the Blood Drive, April 26, 8 AM to 8 PM, Grand Central Terminal, Vanderbilt Hall. The first 250 presenting donors will receive a pair of tickets to an upcoming New York Yankees game. You can sign up in advance by going to this link, drm.nybloodcenter.org/PublicScheduler/GroupLanding.aspx?GroupCode=07694, or you can call 1-800-933-2566 to make an appointment. Please bring an I.D. with photo or signature. Eat well and drink fluids before you donate. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth

Be Courteous - Keep Your Feet Off Seats

We all like to put our feet up after a long day - just don't do it on the train. Shoes can leave dirt on the seats and take up valuable space for others. Wait until you get home to stretch your legs and relax. It will feel that much better! Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth

Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Saturdays & Sundays, April 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 14-29, Now Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic.

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth
Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Saturdays & Sundays, April 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29

Substitute buses will operate between Waterbury and Bridgeport for all trains on Saturdays, April 14, 21 & 28 and for select trains on Sundays, April 15, 22 & 29 to accommodate Devon Bridge work. Bridgeport-bound buses will operate up to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. On Sundays, regular train service will resume with the 7:02 PM train departing Grand Central Terminal, the 8:42 PM departing Bridgeport and the 10:10 PM departing Waterbury. For full details, see https://goo.gl/vdhE7B. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement work. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth
Port Jervis Weekend Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, April 14-15 and 28-29

Substitute bus service will be provided between Port Jervis and Ramsey/Route 17, Saturday through Sunday, on two weekends, April 14-15 and April 28-29, beginning with the 12:40 AM train on Saturday departing from Hoboken and continuing through Sunday. Train service will resume with the 12:40 AM train from Hoboken on early Monday morning. Buses will replace Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Suffern. Some trains will be cancelled and combined. In addition, two connecting trains departing Hoboken and NY Penn Sta. will leave 20 minutes earlier than the regularly scheduled train time. For full details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/PortJ_weekend_418.pdf Thank you for your patience while we make important infrastructure improvements. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth

Port Jervis Weekend Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, April 14-15 and 28-29

Substitute bus service will be provided between Port Jervis and Ramsey/Route 17, Saturday through Sunday, on two weekends, April 14-15 and April 28-29, beginning with the 12:40 AM train on Saturday departing from Hoboken and continuing through Sunday. Train service will resume with the 12:40 AM train from Hoboken on early Monday morning. Buses will replace Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Suffern. Some trains will be cancelled and combined. In addition, two connecting trains departing Hoboken and NY Penn Sta. will leave 20 minutes earlier than the regularly scheduled train time. For full details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/PortJ_weekend_418.pdf Thank you for your patience while we make important infrastructure improvements. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth
Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Saturdays & Sundays, April 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29

Substitute buses will operate between Waterbury and Bridgeport for all trains on Saturdays, April 14, 21 & 28 and for select trains on Sundays, April 15, 22 & 29 to accommodate Devon Bridge work. Bridgeport-bound buses will operate up to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. On Sundays, regular train service will resume with the 7:02 PM train departing Grand Central Terminal, the 8:42 PM departing Bridgeport and the 10:10 PM departing Waterbury. For full details, see https://goo.gl/vdhE7B. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement work. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth
Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 14-29, Now Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth
New Haven Line - WALK Bridge Opening

An opening of the WALK bridge in the vicinity of South Norwalk is schedule for 9:00am and 10:00am today, April 14, 2018. This opening could cause potential delays of 20 -25 minutes. We will provide updates as needed. Please listen for announcements at your station.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 14-29, Now Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth

Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Saturdays & Sundays, April 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29

Substitute buses will operate between Waterbury and Bridgeport for all trains on Saturdays, April 14, 21 & 28 and for select trains on Sundays, April 15, 22 & 29 to accommodate Devon Bridge work. Bridgeport-bound buses will operate up to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. On Sundays, regular train service will resume with the 7:02 PM train departing Grand Central Terminal, the 8:42 PM departing Bridgeport and the 10:10 PM departing Waterbury. For full details, see https://goo.gl/vdhE7B. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement work. Follow us: Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth
Port Jervis Weekend Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, April 14-15 and 28-29

Substitute bus service will be provided between Port Jervis and Ramsey/Route 17, Saturday through Sunday, on two weekends, April 14-15 and April 28-29, beginning with the 12:40 AM train on Saturday departing from Hoboken and continuing through Sunday. Train service will resume with the 12:40 AM train from Hoboken on early Monday morning. Buses will replace Port Jervis Line trains between Port Jervis and Suffern. Some trains will be cancelled and combined. In addition, two connecting trains departing Hoboken and NY Penn Sta. will leave 20 minutes earlier than the regularly scheduled train time. For full details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/PortJ_weekend_418.pdf Thank you for your patience while we make important infrastructure improvements. Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 14-29, Now Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's and Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: - Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf - Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

There will be testing of the SAGA Bridge near Westport from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM today, which may require periodic openings. Any opening could cause delays. We will provide updates as needed. Thank you for your patience.
Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Saturdays & Sundays, April 7-8 & 14-15

Substitute buses will operate between Waterbury and Bridgeport for all trains on Saturdays, April 7 & 14, and for select trains on Sundays, April 8 & 15, to accommodate Devon Bridge work. Bridgeport-bound buses will operate up to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. On Sundays, regular train service will resume with the 7:02 PM train departing Grand Central Terminal, the 8:42 PM departing Bridgeport and the 10:10 PM departing Waterbury. For full details, see https://goo.gl/zhh4JF. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement work.
BKLYN, BM1, BM2, BM3, BM4 and BM5 Buses, No Sunday Service
There is no BM1, BM2, BM3, BM4 and BM5 bus service on Sunday.
Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 7-29

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (April 7-8, 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect from Southeast and Brewster Stations to Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of recent nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast and Brewster Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: There will be no bus service at these stations. Please drive to Southeast for northbound service, and Goldens Bridge, Katonah or North White Plains for southbound trains. Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 7-29

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (April 7-8, 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect from Southeast and Brewster Stations to Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of recent nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast and Brewster Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: There will be no bus service at these stations. Please drive to Southeast for northbound service, and Goldens Bridge, Katonah or North White Plains for southbound trains. Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Saturdays & Sundays, April 7-8 & 14-15

Substitute buses will operate between Waterbury and Bridgeport for all trains on Saturdays, April 7 & 14, and for select trains on Sundays, April 8 & 15, to accommodate Devon Bridge work. Bridgeport-bound buses will operate up to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. On Sundays, regular train service will resume with the 7:02 PM train departing Grand Central Terminal, the 8:42 PM departing Bridgeport and the 10:10 PM departing Waterbury. For full details, see https://goo.gl/zhh4JF. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement work.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 7-29

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (April 7-8, 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect from Southeast and Brewster Stations to Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of recent nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast and Brewster Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: There will be no bus service at these stations. Please drive to Southeast for northbound service, and Goldens Bridge, Katonah or North White Plains for southbound trains. Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 7-29

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (April 7-8, 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect from Southeast and Brewster Stations to Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of recent nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf Southeast and Brewster Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: There will be no bus service at these stations. Please drive to Southeast for northbound service, and Goldens Bridge, Katonah or North White Plains for southbound trains. Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Welcome to the Metro-North Lost & Found

Nearly 30,000 items are turned into Metro-North's Lost & Found Facility every year. We have established a Lost and Found process that is designed to recover and return as many items as possible to our customers. If you have lost an item, the first step in the recovery process is to review the Lost and Found FAQ's. The second step is to complete an electronic Lost Property Customer Inquiry Form at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/found/web_cust_select_ie.cfm For safety and security reasons, please note: - Metro-North employees are not permitted to disrupt train radio communication. - Customers are not permitted in non-public areas on Metro-North property. Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth

Welcome to the Metro-North Lost & Found

Nearly 30,000 items are turned into Metro-North's Lost & Found Facility every year. We have established a Lost and Found process that is designed to recover and return as many items as possible to our customers. If you have lost an item, the first step in the recovery process is to review the Lost and Found FAQ's. The second step is to complete an electronic Lost Property Customer Inquiry Form at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/found/web_cust_select_ie.cfm For safety and security reasons, please note: - Metro-North employees are not permitted to disrupt train radio communication. - Customers are not permitted in non-public areas on Metro-North property. Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetroNorth - Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mtametronorth

Upper Harlem Line Substitute Bus Service for Saturdays and Sundays, April 7-29

For Saturdays and Sundays throughout the month of April (April 7-8, 14-15, 21-22 & 28-29), substitute bus service will be in effect from Southeast and Brewster Stations to Goldens Bridge due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area that occurred as a result of recent nor'easters. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Substitute bus service is being provided between Southeast and Goldens Bridge as follows: - Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson. For full schedule details, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic4_3.pdf - Southeast and Brewster Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures. For a full schedule, please see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Southeast4_3.pdf - Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: There will be no bus service at these stations. Please drive to Southeast for northbound service, and Goldens Bridge, Katonah or North White Plains for southbound trains. Please refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements and check back to http://www.mta.info/mnr for updates. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Harlem Line Service - Late Night Schedule Changes

Due to construction, and the resulting single tracking, select Harlem Line trains between the hours of 9:30 PM and 11:30 PM will operate between 3 and 15 minutes later than the originally scheduled train times. These new times will be effective until further notice, and will be included in the June 2018 printed timetable revision. The following trains will be affected: INBOUND The 9:23 PM train from Wassaic will depart at 9:31 PM and operates 8 minutes later from Wassaic through Patterson, arriving at Southeast 7 minutes later; The 10:11 PM connecting train from Southeast will depart at 10:16 and operates 5 minutes later from Southeast through Grand Central Terminal; The 11:02 PM train from North White Plains will depart NWP at 11:05 PM, and operates 3 minutes later from North White Plains through Grand Central Terminal; OUTBOUND The 11:32 PM train from Southeast will depart Southeast 5 minutes later at 11:37 PM, and operates up to 15 minutes later from Patterson through Wassaic stations. Customers can also refer to our interactive schedules page for train times at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm , or download the TrainTime app http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm for mobile access. Please listen for station announcements, and check for updates at http://www.mta.info/mnr and on social media. Thank you for your patience while we make these important changes to our infrastructure.
